CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We compared the experimental I SC under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation and the I SC calculated by integrating the EQE and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Material Name" entities:

1. I SC (Indoor Solar Cell)
2. AM1.5 (American Society of Testing and Materials Standard Solar Spectrum)
3. EQE (Efficiency of a Solar Cell)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! My apologies for the confusion earlier. Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. I SC (Indoor Solar Cell)

The other entities in the paragraph (e.g. "simulated AM1.5 irradiation", "actual AM1.5 solar spectra") are not Material Name entities, so I have removed them from the list.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| I SC |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We compared the experimental I SC under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation and the I SC calculated by integrating the EQE and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Name" entities:

1. I SC (short for "irradiance spectral composition") - This is the property being measured or calculated in the experiment.
2. AM1.5 (short for "Air Mass 1.5") - This is a standardized solar irradiance spectrum used as a reference in the experiment.
3. EQE (short for "effective quantum efficiency") - This is another property being measured or calculated in the experiment, which represents the efficiency of the solar cell in converting incoming photons into electrical current.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure! Here are the relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the given paragraph:

1. I SC (short for "irradiance spectral composition") - This is a material property that refers to the distribution of solar irradiance across different wavelengths.
2. EQE (short for "effective quantum efficiency") - This is a material property that refers to the efficiency of the solar cell in converting incoming photons into electrical current.

So, the two relevant entities that refer to Material Property in the paragraph are:

1. I SC
2. EQE

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities that refer to Material Property in the given paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| I SC |
| EQE |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: We compared the experimental I SC under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation and the I SC calculated by integrating the EQE and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra.

Let's think step by step.

In this paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. Experimental I SC (Experimental Intensity of Solar Concentration) - This is the value of the intensity of solar concentration measured experimentally under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation.
2. I SC (Intensity of Solar Concentration) - This is the value of the intensity of solar concentration calculated by integrating the EQE (Efficiency of Quantum Efficiency) and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra.

Both of these values represent a property of the solar concentration, specifically its intensity, which is an important parameter in the context of solar energy harvesting and conversion.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of a material property in the given paragraph:

1. Experimental I SC (Experimental Intensity of Solar Concentration) - This entity refers to the value of the intensity of solar concentration measured experimentally under the simulated AM1.5 irradiation.
2. I SC (Intensity of Solar Concentration) - This entity refers to the value of the intensity of solar concentration calculated by integrating the EQE (Efficiency of Quantum Efficiency) and the actual AM1.5 solar spectra.

These two entities are the only ones that refer to the value of a material property in the given paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to the value of a material property, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Experimental I SC |
| I SC |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
